main event: A geologist observed a stationary unidentified flying object in Phoenix, Arizona for approximately 35 minutes on 19 November 1963.
interesting points: The object was observed to hover and move slowly at times before accelerating in different directions.,The object was described as spherical or round and appeared golden orange-yellow with brilliance and glow.,Visibility during the sighting was good despite high haze and slight breeze.,The observer was a 57-year-old psychiatrist with unknown reliability.,No military or civilian air traffic was reported in the area at the time of the sighting.
